result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas N Hurdle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Court to apply the $500 cash bail on deposit.  Remaining Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.    Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Department.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances  without a valid prescription, or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No use or possession of CBD products.    Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Attend Victim Impact Panel.    No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  Sentence commencing forthwith.  Court grants 4 days credit.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 1 if revoked and imposed

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:53 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Nicholas N Hurdle in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and inquires how the matter is proceeding.  Atty. Menden confirms her client is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Menden confirms the offer.  Atty. Menden notes they have not received the blood test results back but defense is still prepared to proceed today without them.  State also notes there needs to be a plea to Count 2 as well pursuant to the offer.  Atty. Menden reviews her emails with the State and notes that is correct and will amend the plea questionnaire to include a plea to Count 2 as well.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 & 2, Court finds defendant guilty.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arugments made by Atty. Menden.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
Court orders the following:

Total Prison: 4 Years
Initial Confinement: 2 Years
Extended Supervision: 2 Years
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Term of Probation: 2 Years

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
No use/possession of CBD products
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling
Attend Victim Impact Panel
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are
            Purchases used, stored, packaged, or distributed
No Operation of a Motor Vehicle without a valid drivers license


CONDITION TIME:
280 Days (4 Days Credit) in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).  Sentence commendces forthwith.

FINE: $3,343.00; 
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $40.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Brookfield Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
**Court to apply the $500.00 Cash Bail on deposit; remainder to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  


COUNT 2:
Court orders the following:

90 Days Jail - Consecutive to Count 1 IF revoked and sentence imposed.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
No use/possession of CBD products
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are
            Purchases used, stored, packaged, or distributed
No Operation of a Motor Vehicle without a valid drivers license

COSTS:  $243.00;
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00; 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
